intro: Eriostemon nutans, commonly known as the drooping lily-rush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are often nodding or drooping, giving it a distinctive appearance. Eriostemon nutans is an important component of wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
